reference.title: DITAVAL elements
reference.shortdesc: A conditional processing profile (DITAVAL file) is used to identify which values are to be used for conditional processing during a particular output, build, or some other purpose. The profile should have an extension of .ditaval.

section.p: The DITAVAL format has several elements: val, the root element, can contain a style-conflict element followed by prop or revprop elements; the prop and revprop elements can contain startflag and endflag elements; and the startflag and endflag elements can contain alt-text elements.

section.title: Notes on ditaval messages
section.p: Conditional processing code should provide a report of any attribute values encountered in content that do not have an action associated with them.

section.title: Note on ditaval flagging of images
section.p: If an image in DITA content becomes flagged using a background color, the color should be represented as a thick border. If a foreground color is expressed, it should be represented as a thin border.
